name: Bay Area Coordinated Entry
description: Centralized access to homeless services, shelter, and housing resources
fullDescription: Coordinated Entry is the standardized system for accessing homeless services throughout the Bay Area, connecting people experiencing homelessness with housing and support services.
whatTheyOffer:
- Assessment of housing and service needs
- Connection to emergency shelter
- Rapid rehousing programs
- Permanent supportive housing referrals
- Case management services
- Connection to healthcare, benefits, and other services
howToGetIt:
1. Call 2-1-1 for homeless services in your area
2. Or visit a local access point (varies by county)
3. Complete coordinated entry assessment
4. Get matched with available housing resources
5. Work with case manager on housing plan
keywords: coordinated entry, homeless, shelter, housing, 211, navigation, case management, homeless services
